website_summaries.verdict: A nicely packaged option that works well as a gift, but with only 4 molds per tray, we feel it's a bit overpriced.
pros: Silicone construction is suitable for both oven and freezer use
Produces reasonably thick walls and bases
cons: Some owners found them difficult to remove and others complained of inconsistent shapes

customer_reviews.title: amazing shot glass mold!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to make chocolate shot glasses to make for a Christmas Eve party, could not be more happier with it. Bought chocolate from my local craft store, melted chocolate (16oz) and poured into mold. Froze for about 30 minutes and popped them right out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I bought this 14 years ago, and it's still working!
customer_reviews.text: I fill up a bucket with these ice cubes throughout the week. It's a fun party item. The ice does quickly melt and really is just a one time use item before it becomes slippery or starts leaking. Great party gift!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tan

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad
customer_reviews.text: I remember that I can take this out and use the glass maybe for few shots and it become a little bit too thin to let me drink more of the liquor. However, if you make more in advance, it still really good!!
customer_reviews.author: Walt C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Idea, works rather well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at a party and it was a smash :p All four "ice glasses" form just fine with the exception of 2 slight budges that appear on the exterior of the "glass." This does not affect usability or stability much as I think uneven freezing of the base would cause more stability issues (which I have done by not placing on a VERY flat surface). These "glasses" are lots of fun to bring out for parties and when they get dropped on the floor (they will get dropped, people are clumsy) it is not a hard or worrisome clean up... no real glass! Great product, I really like it and do not regret my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Monsanto

customer_reviews.title: The best on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Stunning quilty and very pleased with the item. Really glad to purchase this. Well packaged and arrived very quickly. I highly recommend the product and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: monkey

customer_reviews.title: Good idea?
customer_reviews.text: These looked so cool that I had to purchase them. (drum roll, rim shot). Yes, you will have shot glasses made of ice. And if you are taking chilled/frozen cocktails/spirits and poring them in and immediately shooting the entire contents, fine, fine, excellent, awesome. If they are out of the freezer for too long, they will start to melt and drip. You can't hold on to them very long because... they are ice. So, pretty narrow focus, but really, really cool. (drum roll, rim shot - get used to it).
customer_reviews.author: Mr Persnickety

customer_reviews.title: Really neat, looks great, functional
customer_reviews.text: REALLY hard to get out of the mold lol. My wife cut her finger trying to pry them out so she leaves it to me now. Also because the space in between all 4 of the glass molds doesnt cool as quickly, you can get small bumps in the glass. Its hard to explain but it makes getting them out of the mold a real chore. Once out however, they are really awesome, nice and thick, hold an oz of liquid without issue and are super fun at parties. We spent 2 weeks making them and filled an ice chest that we took to a party with them and they were a huge hit. Great party item!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Party
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my brother in law. He loved them and used them the next day. They worked great and looked perfect. They keep the shots so cold and fun! Everyone thought they were great!
customer_reviews.author: CJG

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, bad in reality
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of not having to wash shot glasses, or being able to throw it down and have it shatter when you are done with it. However, here is the reality. 1. They melt. I know that Ice melts, but what you don’t think about is the mess that it makes. Even in the 3 minutes it takes for your buddies to get together for a shot. 2. They are hard to remove from the mold. They usually start melting by the time I am done. 3. People throw them and break them before the shots are done being dispensed.
customer_reviews.author: Mowens

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use !!!!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun to use as an alternative shot glass. Although can be slightly messy if you aren’t quick to drink!
customer_reviews.author: Chandany S.

customer_reviews.title: Bottoms Up!!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Just have to use them quickly. I poured vodka in mine and it cracked almost immediately. Figured I'd let it chill just a little but started leaking within 30-45 secs. (After the shot, I put their entire 'glass' in a regular glass and made a cocktail). Another reviewer had a good idea to unmold & fill them and put back in the freezer until ready to use. Put them on a tray just in case. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepyhead

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for a birthday party and they were great! The mold held up perfectly and there were no breaks. I love these shot glasses because they are so thick walled that they don't leak or break easily. Pros: -makes thick sturdy shot glasses -actually a shot Cons -it was a little tought to get the made glasses out of the mold Pointers: be sure to chill any liquor before pouring it into a shot glass made of ice, otherwise it'll melt real fast! Also, these are a bit slippery, but that is expected from something made of ice! Overall the product was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: kmostajeran

customer_reviews.title: Great for candy too.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mold because I was making a tequila bottle shaped cake and I wanted to include edible shot glasses in the decoration. I was able to fill these with molten sugar glass to create a hard candy shot glass. The sugar was at a temperature of about 300 degrees. I filled the mold with this mixture and set it aside to cool. After a couple of hours, I unmolded four perfectly formed glasses that accented my cake perfectly. The glasses slid right out without any problems. I expect that chocolate would work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Funny and cool for a moment, then impractical.
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of hard to get them out of the mold (running under warm water helps), and don't try to hold it for longer than it takes to take a shot of liquor because the ice will hurt your hand if you're still relatively sober. It's a funny thing to bring out when you decide to take shots, but it's very impractical and the "glasses" have been left on my coffee table by people who've had drinks and everything gets wet and gross in a few minutes (my fault I guess)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but not that great
customer_reviews.text: I got these for laughs, mainly, and that is what they are for. The shot glass is thick and melts quickly. I forgot one on the table after "putting it down" and it melted, obviously. The disappointment stems from the shape of the glass you consistently get. We've managed one set of decent ones and a number of crooked and awkwardly shaped figures. Now, we do it by layers. I 1/3 of an inch at a time. It's a fun party item and a good gift, but you can live without it easily and save the $7.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Great for White Elephant game
customer_reviews.text: Was a hit item at white elephant! I was tempted to purchase one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Mason

customer_reviews.title: Extremely cool
customer_reviews.text: Great item with one flaw. The tray itself is a bit too floppy. Transporting the tray from the sink to the freezer results in spilled water. If each individual compartment is not filled completely the base of the shot glass is thinner than desired (the top of the cube compartment is the bottom of the shot glass). A thinner bottom results in a quicker 'melt through.' So if you 'sip' rather than 'knock it back' it COULD pose an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great hostess gift with a bottle of Liquor
customer_reviews.text: This item molds the perfect shot glass out of ice. It is a great conversation starter - an even better hostess gift with a bottle of Liquour and if you're organized enough - bring along a few already made shot glasses in a cooler. Kids love it too having them made out of Kool-Aid or Lemonade. They are extremely easy to unmold. The mold itself is easy to clean. This is a great fun product.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Cool Shooter Ice Tray
customer_reviews.text: Great for parties, or just having chilled shots of something like fireball. Haven't done it yet but I'm planning to make gummies using these in the very near future. Right now they have been used for shots and boilermakers and sometimes just as regular icecubes.
customer_reviews.author: Askjok

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a COOL item !!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for it's purpose. The mold is sturdy but not so that you can't get the shots out. It does take some doing, but they come out looking EXACTLY like a shot glass. I actually put some regular cubes in a drinking glass, pour in soda, then place in the ice shot glass & add alcohol .. soooooo unique and keeps it all COLD for a long time !! Great item !!
customer_reviews.author: Cam Allison Group

customer_reviews.title: These are great! I love that they are silicone because I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I love that they are silicone because I had the original ones from plastic and I actually broke the plastic trying to get them out. Anyway, these are a great gift for a 21 year old! I also love that someone mentioned they made chocolate cups with these! That's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: TJ's WifeTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not so great Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Need a gift for around $10? This works great. Got it for my 22 year old brother for his birthday, and it went over real well. And even if he didn't like it, it was only about $10. Update: Also got these for a friend. Both my friend and my brother pretty much never used them. I tried my friends and the silicon ripped when when taking the ice out. It was still usable, but I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Souza

customer_reviews.title: This was an excellent gift for a friends 21st birthday
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent gift for a friends 21st birthday. They're definitely a novelty item and we don't use them often, but still a lot of fun! If you plan ahead you can easily make multiples using just the one tray since they come out of the mold so easily
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Cute little gift!
customer_reviews.text: I got as a gift. They work pretty well! When freezing, a flat surface is required otherwise the frozen shot glass won’t stand up straight. Perfect for a little cheap gift!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite brands
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite brands, I bought several models with good material, excellent appearance and fine workmanship. They are very convenient and easy to clean.Very good!!By the way, it feels really good.The appearance of the package is in good condition, without knock, scratch or damage
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Jessie

customer_reviews.title: they're ice!
customer_reviews.text: they may be the coolest thing you've seen all day, but they're still ice. you really can't complain that they melt after some use, that's not the mold's fault. it works fine, they come out just like the picture shows. they last for one maybe two uses before they start to melt on you. its a cheap and easy way to always have shot glasses on hand for the party, and not having to worry about drunks breaking them... just make sure you make enough!
customer_reviews.author: B. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift white elephant choice
customer_reviews.text: This was my choice for white elephant purchase this last Christmas. Lol...Everyone loved and wanted to steal it. Really good gift 21+ Everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Heidikins

customer_reviews.title: Fun but awkward.
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for an ice bar or somewhere where the ambient temperature is near or below freezing, as they melt really quickly in a normal environment. Although I guess that's just a better excuse to take more shots in a shorter period of time. Additionally they can be difficult to hold while melting, especially after a few repetitions. So try to drink liquors that wont stain or in a place where and while wearing clothes that it wont matter.
customer_reviews.author: Devil's Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great! No 'bump' on the bottom of them. Plan on freezing them for 2 days, then run some water on them and pop them out. Repeat. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Worked but Perfect
customer_reviews.text: So even with my freezer perfectly level these shot glasses always come out a bit off level which, as they are melting dance across the table. Also, rather then the water expanding upwards as you would think it would, the rubber mold is so thin it pushes the ice out into the cup. If the molds were different or a bit stiffer this probably wouldn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: MicahO

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: makes 4 great shot glasses that can be thrown as though you are thor! If you want the glasses to come out clear. Get enough water to fill it. then boil the water twice. Use that boiled water to make the glasses and they will come out fresh and clear. Make sure to leave them in the freezer for a good amount of hours though to make sure they fully freeze
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Use it for a month.
customer_reviews.text: I have been used this glass mold for a month. Certainly, the only thing that is supposed to do is to make shooters shot glasses. Affirmatively, this mold works great! The glasses are fun and gorgeous in a certain way, the mold is still as good as new and notice that I used it several times. In sum, It's a good quality product and does what is supposed to do. Totallyu worth the price. PD: I recommend to leave the mold in the light for at least 3-5 minutes before attempting to remove the glasses, it will definitely facilitate the removal.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely the best addition to my home bar ever. Now, as for the people who say things such as "It produced a hole" or "Could only use once" or "Slippery to hold" All I can say to you is THEY ARE ICE CUBE SHOT GLASSES, what do you expect....??? I make a batch everyday and keep in a frozen container that holds about 35 of them. I am ready for a novelty shot at any time!!
customer_reviews.author: SpencerTeri

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cousin when she turned 21. She made cranberry shot glasses and drank with her parents. They are easy to use because the silicone is so flexible and you can get the glasses out without breaking them. They get sticky and the bottoms are uneven sometimes but who cares? A novelty and not overly practical, but fun at parties. Made a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: J. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Novelty item ONLY. Even frozen solid, you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Novelty item ONLY. Even frozen solid, you have 30 seconds, max, to drink the shot before it starts melting through. And don't even bother trying to make shot glasses from any type of juice. You only get about 10 seconds before the liquid starts finding holes to leak through.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this originally to give to my brother for his bar. Tried them out, and now I'll probably have to buy another set for my brother, as I'm keeping these for myself. Be careful when you use these. Chilled vodka and tequila shots taste so much better in these 'ice shooters', that you may be tempted to drink more than you originally intended.
customer_reviews.author: tohearwell

customer_reviews.title: Not really like the pic
customer_reviews.text: The ice shot glasses don't come out like the pic. They're more like an ice cube with a hole in the top ... no design like the ones in the pic. Hard to hold, too ... they're pretty small and no place to get a grip. Ok for something different at a party, but definitely not something you're going to use often.
customer_reviews.author: RJH

customer_reviews.title: Cool item, pun intended
customer_reviews.text: Great item, only complaint is that it can be hard to get your item out of the mold without breaking. Tried lemonade (for tequila shooters) and the lemonade didn't freeze solid enough. Not the molds fault. Going to try chocolate, might try dusting with powdered sugar before filling to help with release. Water freezes solid and comes out much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Larson

customer_reviews.title: they are great. It hasn't change color
customer_reviews.text: I bought them a while ago and while I don't use them often or on a daily basis, they are great. It hasn't change color, it doesn't add any flavor to the ice, it hasn't broken. I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool idea
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool. Obviously they will melt if you keep the liquor in the drink too long and they will slide around quite a bit too (which is expected). If you are taking shots, do it by the sink so the water from the ice stays around the sink. In order to get these out of the mold, you have to temporarily run hot water over the silicon side in order to get the shot glasses to slide out easier. Great idea for a party. If you know of a college party girl, this will be right up her alley.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ice shots
customer_reviews.text: Basically, this shot glass mold is exactly what I hoped it would be. Easy to use and get great ice shot glasses - I've even found that using the ice shot glass makes taking shots of less expensive liquor smoother and more enjoyable. Can't say I've had any issues to date and, in fact, I liked this item so much I bought one for my friend. I make about a dozen glasses over the course of a day and just leave them in my freezer for the right occasion. If you are thinking about getting it - go for it - there are no drawbacks whatsoever and it is a great party item. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Krullett

customer_reviews.title: Great conversation piece!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Ice Bar in Sweden where all of their glasses are made of ice! Thought this would be a fun reminder!! They are very easy to remove from mold. The only problem we have is when using them, they have a tendency of sliding on a smooth surface...unless used outside in the dead of winter!! Lol. But all in all we love them!
customer_reviews.author: Roni Renee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I got this and I filled it with water to start. That worked great and I wouldn't say that it was easy to get the frozen glasses out of the mold but it wasn't that bad. I tried jello next and that was a struggle to get them out of the mold; they kept ripping. I had several of my friends try it just to make sure that it wasn't me, and the same thing happened. I gave up on the jello and I just use flavored water. People seem to really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie

customer_reviews.title: These are tiny and the bottoms of them form kind-of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are tiny and the bottoms of them form kind-of a bubble/bowing effect so they don't sit flush. One of the pictures shows a person holding one filled with a yellow fluid but the size is misleading. They're actually quite small.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Honest

customer_reviews.title: Fred's are the Better of the Ones I Bought
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and also bought the HDE molds. The 'Fred' molds are definitely better and larger overall. Understand that when you make these, the ice needs to be thick enough so they don't immediately melt. the Fred's probably yield about a shot or so of liquid. The HDE's are much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dibb

customer_reviews.title: good cold fun
customer_reviews.text: Got the item fast, shot glasses sometimes end up a little lopsided but usually not a problem unless left on really uneven surface in the freezer. My friend said the ones he had were hard to hold, these seem fine. PROS: cools your shots no dirty shot glasses after just drop in hot water... CONS: cools your hands leaves water puddles if left around
customer_reviews.author: DarcazX

customer_reviews.title: cool idea hard to make work
customer_reviews.text: the ice shot glasses crack and spill really easily, this is such a cool idea im still working on making it work but right now i can say they dont work out all that well.
customer_reviews.author: kt43

customer_reviews.title: Really Neat Idea!
customer_reviews.text: These are a novel idea. They work well, but the only issue is they do not freeze totally flat on the bottom. This can be lessened with bottled water as this is mainly due to ions in the water causing it to freeze irregularly. This is not necessarily a defect in the product, but they could improve it by adding a "lid" that keeps the bottom even.
customer_reviews.author: abqnm

customer_reviews.title: This is Fun
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this fun toy. I found that if you fill the "negative space" underside with water and freeze that first, there is less deformity in the final product. The only problem I encountered was when I was so eager to punch out a new crop of little jewels I didn't let it freeze long enough. TIP TO CLIP: If you're going to transport them in a cooler for a picnic or party, use dry ice. You'll experience less "melt-through" problems. Really fun product at a good price point.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wrege

customer_reviews.title: not bad in begining... smell after leaving them in the freezer
customer_reviews.text: These started out as a very cool thing... I used them the first few times and they worked fairly well. I had a bit of an issue as the depth of the glasses wasn't think enough on the bottom. Also, the latex smell began to get a little more toxic as I left them in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Hunterman

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but don't really work well.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun, but when you fill with liquor, it jumps from air bubble to air bubble and leaks out fast. I found that if I filled the ice tray one fourth at a time, there were few enough bubbles that you could do a shot if you moved quickly. I still haven't tried jello shots, but intend to. Maybe one day I can figure out how to make ice with no bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Such fun!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this with melted chocolate, then filled them with Rumpleminze for a peppermint chocolate shot. Big fun! I'm looking forward to freezing other things. Make sure you fill the molds to the very top. Otherwise the bottom of the shot glass will be too thin, and your liquid will drip out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Winn

customer_reviews.title: Made a beautiful unique birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this is a gift for a friend's birthday. both he and his wife absolutely love them. Makes me happy to see them every time I go over there because I know they get used.
customer_reviews.author: Hyung Cho

customer_reviews.title: Fun stuff
customer_reviews.text: Little tough getting the shot glasses from the mold. But they are great for shots
customer_reviews.author: Kip

customer_reviews.title: Simple fun
customer_reviews.text: I give it a five star rating because durable, easy to use, and it's been a hit at my parties. I recommend this to anyone that wants to liven a party, no matter what time of year. To slow melting for extended use during the party: - Fill the mold with water to where the base is as thick as possible - In use, fill with COLD liquid - Right after each use, return to freezer on a paper plate or something When it finally melts through, just put it in another drink! Talk about environmentally friendly..and no worries about shattering it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: chill and be saucy with this frozen shot glass mold.
customer_reviews.text: Frozen shot glasses are great. Not for all night drinking unless you chill by the freezer. Good for taking a couple of shots in a short period then disposal. No evidence if done right.
customer_reviews.author: hpyamzcstmr528

customer_reviews.title: Fun party gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift. The molds work really well but often the bottoms of the ice shot glasses are lumpy and do not sit well on a counter. This is a very minor drawback as the shotglasses still work well and are a fun party addition.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Shot Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Son was thrilled with these and can't wait to use them.
customer_reviews.author: joanie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Arrived prompttly. Packaged securely. Just what I wanted. Can't wait to try them out.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Carver

customer_reviews.title: Hit of the party
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loved these at the party! You're able to do two or three shots out of these before they start melting. Which is pretty impressive, especially with how warm it's been this summer. Cute and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brown

customer_reviews.title: I really like using flavorful mixes to freeze in the forms
customer_reviews.text: A really neat way to serve drinks to your invited guests. The only problem is some people are slow drinkers and the glass starts melting and finally starts leaking. I really like using flavorful mixes to freeze in the forms. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great for Summer Get Togethers!
customer_reviews.text: The mold makes great ice shot glasses. If I had to attempt to try and find anything wrong with it I would have to say that if you don't run some hot water over the mold the ice is a little hard getting out. Other than that I've used it several times with friends and enjoyed!
customer_reviews.author: tyler emerson

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother for Christmas and he was so pumped that we filled them right away. We took them out after a couple hours and they felt frozen, but it wasn't completely frozen and water melted it real quickly. Make sure you freeze them over night so they're solid. He said they worked great after that!!
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: You deserve it.
customer_reviews.text: A great thing to use in a hot summer day is to freeze some ice cubes and add them to a glass of chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Carli McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: These are fun
customer_reviews.text: add a little bit of food coloring to the water and make yourself some colored ones. awesome in the summer time to make sure people drink them fast. and there is nothing like slamming them down and breaking them when your done!
customer_reviews.author: Just an average guy

customer_reviews.title: I hear they have been fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as a housewarming gift for a young friend. I hear they have been fun and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: elkile

customer_reviews.title: Novel Toy for the entire family
customer_reviews.text: Novel toy to play with. I've frozen Cranberry Juice, Orange juice, Tonic Water & others just to see what I come up with. It works as advertised, and is only a little tricky to get out of the mold. The shot glass starts melting in your hand right away, whether or not there's booze in the mix or inside. It can be a bit messy, so outside parties would be best. Our favorite use for it, however, is to put Cranberry juice in it, then drop the finished shot glass into a Pepsi. Great flavor & my daughter enjoys picking it out & chewing on the pieces. Hope this helps your decision. :)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ellenwood

customer_reviews.title: What else would you expect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a nice little novelty. It is not going to change your life or replace your shot glasses forever, but you will have a bit of fun with it. Make a few juice glasses, wrap them in wax paper and leave them in the fridge until you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Stoopkid

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: way cool except they suck Update Threw it away One star
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: nice novelty item
customer_reviews.text: Cool little novelty item the only issue I had was it can be a little difficult to get the items out of the mold sometimes. If they figure out a way to fix that then it would receive the 5th star. But over all it is a good product
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I had a party, then busted these out. Filled them with vodka and served with caviar. Was I just the stud party host! ;) Regarding any comments about the difficulty popping them out of the molds, the more I use these, the easier it seems to get. Buy these! So cool!
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: Starts Dripping Almost Immediately
customer_reviews.text: I had read some of the reviews and knew it wasn't the most practical gift, but thought it would be cool for a shot or two on my husband's birthday. I told everyone to take their shots quickly, but these were leaking booze all over the place before we could even take a picture. I had read chilling the liquor makes this happen more slowly, but definitely a disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L P

customer_reviews.title: good party favor buy
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of this product, and because it is made out of silcone it's flexible and u could even bake something in it(obviously for non-shot purposes) but i found that it was a little tough to get the ice shot glasses out (even after running them under warm water) and well they melt.. obviously inevitable but thats a for sure drawback... you have to start making these a few days ahead of time if you are going to have a big party.. but overall good product and quick shipping is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: greenkneespaige

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea, needs some work
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool idea and when you can get the glasses out it works pretty well. My criticism is that the inside walls get bulges in them making it very hard to get them out and then they don't look as cool anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: An Alcoholics Best Friend
customer_reviews.text: I love these Ice Shot Glasses. I mix the water with freshly squeezed lemon juice and i fill the mold. Once the are frozen I pour my favorite tequilla and it ready to drink.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to chip the sides when removing them so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute product. Everyone loves when I pull them out. Easy to chip the sides when removing them so I usually only get 2 or 3 of the four.
customer_reviews.author: collin

customer_reviews.title: Cool Shooters
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these at Christmas for friends. They all are happy and enjoying them. It was fun to have such positive reactions from small gifts! I'll buy more, and I do recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Grace L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my nephew. He never mentioned anything about it. I really think they are cool and wish I used them before giving them as a gift. I can imagine putting scotch in them and drinking it cold.
customer_reviews.author: GinoRP

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading another review. They had suggested putting lime juice in water so that it would sink to the bottom and end on the rim of the shot glass. It works fantastic. These can be a little difficult to remove from the silicon at times but its worth the hassle. I usually get about 2 tequila shots out of a glass then smash it on the ground (outside) after because, hey, it's not glass.
customer_reviews.author: jonnycomelately

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: I knew the shot glasses wouldn't just slide out of the mold, but it is pretty difficult to get them out. It may just take some practice but I haven't found an easy way to remove them in the first couple of rounds. Other than that it works great, I suggest using very cold liquor (chilled in the freezer) with the shot glasses as well to get more than a couple of shots from them before holes melt into them.
customer_reviews.author: Beau W.

customer_reviews.title: The person who received this gift thought it was awesome and immediately made a set of shooters
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift. The person who received this gift thought it was awesome and immediately made a set of shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to put juice and other stuff in for kids while outside or in the pool. they are thick and only hold a little liquid (about 1 1/2 shots) but are great for kids to eat outside while they melt.
customer_reviews.author: D. Oberholtzer

customer_reviews.title: COOL!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my brother and he thought is was the coolest thing ever... pun semi-indended. He has since put it to very good use!
customer_reviews.author: Elia D. Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for parties - we made several in advance, and they were a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. They make a really thick nice shot glass. They froze quickly too. We were able to make several glasses in one day. I highly recommend for anyone wanting to add a little twist to their party.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alcott

customer_reviews.title: Makes icy cold shot glasses.
customer_reviews.text: The shot glasses come out pretty nice, the only problem is that it takes a long time for the water to completely freeze, and if the mold is not on a level surface in the freezer the bottom of the shot glass will be uneven and not sit straight up.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery, nice gift
customer_reviews.text: I saw these mentioned in an article about gifts to get for every friend, I got these for my college buddies(I purchased 2) and they were delivery very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Loves to read

customer_reviews.title: Good to use
customer_reviews.text: L bought this for a party with my friends. They are very happy with it. Lt bring us joy
customer_reviews.author: Sean Boulay

customer_reviews.title: Always a Hit
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that these ice shot glasses are pretty awesome and always a hit at a party. For a couple of days prior to a party I typically freeze them overnight, take them out of the molds in the morning, fill up the molds again, repeat as necessary. I normally form about 8 shot glasses a day, that I just store in the freezer ready for use. More work than a typical shot glass, but I like the easy clean up and novelty effect - plus who doesn't love an ice cold shot.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Morse

customer_reviews.title: way too small
customer_reviews.text: The shot glasses are way too small and very difficult to use. it's hard to tell their actual size in the stock photo, and the amount of fluid they hold does not make their difficulty of use worth it. Not terribly displeased only because we all got a good laugh at the absurdity of trying to take a shot together with such a small and pointless product. At least it didnt cost much.
customer_reviews.author: sherwin shahlapour

customer_reviews.title: Works great. They work great if you're indoors but outdoors ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. They work great if you're indoors but outdoors in he heat you can only use them once real fast and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Fred Cool Shooters Shot Glass Mold
customer_reviews.text: Fred Cool Shooters Shot Glass Mold. this will be the third set of shooter type molds I have purchased. They can be a lot of fun at party, you just have to remember to grab them on your way out the next day,
customer_reviews.author: oshirenshi

customer_reviews.title: What to get the guy who has everything
customer_reviews.text: Brother in law loved it, and has spent many pleasant hours dreaming up some pretty cool (and some strange) combinations. Jello shooter cups to hold shots? Fun stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fun shots
customer_reviews.text: This mold works perfect. Down size is it only makes 4 at a time. Up size is that they are thick and sturdy. We have had a lot of fun with them. Plan on making fruit juice shot glasses this summer when grandkids visit.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Campbell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these molds so much
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these molds so much!!! The are flexible and easy to work with. They also tolerate HOT boiling sugar which is what I used them for!!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: There are a hit here at our Friday afternoon cul-de-sac happy hours. Definitely worth the investment. Everyone loves them and they definitely are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Fun item
customer_reviews.text: This works well and is a fun novelty item. The ice shot glasses it makes don't stay frozen for long, but for something fun and semi useful it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: tequila by the pool? no other way
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't resist buying this, and i am very happy that i did. this weekend, i was chilling out by the pool on a blazing hot day when my crazy uncle came by with a bottle of 1800 tequila. when he demanded that we take some shots, i went straight to the freezer. WOW! everyone was freaking out from these. Only down side is that eventually they melt... need to buy another. great novelty item.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac J

customer_reviews.title: PARTY TIME
customer_reviews.text: Just remember to start making them a day or two before the party, i did and changed them out and kept a try of frozen shot glasses in my freezer and had about 40 of them! it was great and everyone loved it
customer_reviews.author: Connor Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Use!
customer_reviews.text: These are fun! Can be used in the freezer and the oven.
customer_reviews.author: jjwilson283

product_meta.title: Fred COOL SHOOTERS Shot Glass Mold
product_meta.description:
What's cooler than a shot glass made of ice? Fill Cool Shooters with water or your favorite juice, freeze, and then pop out four fully-formed frozen shot glasses. A great way to add a little nip to your favorite sip!

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Fred's COOL SHOOTERS is the original fill and chill shot glass mold! It's a great way to add a little nip to your favorite sip!
Fill COOL SHOOTERS with water or your favorite juice, freeze, and then pop out four fully-formed with frozen shot glasses. You can even use the mold for things like chocolate and jello!
The unique design of COOL SHOOTERS features frozen shot glass that look like miniature beer steins! These are sure to be a conversation starter at your next party.
The COOL SHOOTERS shot glass tray is made with quality, durable BPA-free silicone. The flexible material makes the ice easy to remove.
The COOL SHOOTERS tray is dishwasher safe and easy to clean! The construction is durable so it can be used over and over again!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
